intro: Epilobium × grenieri, commonly known as the hybrid willowherb, is a perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters during the summer months. It thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils and is often found in wetlands, stream banks, and disturbed areas. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and naturalized areas.
